intro: Campylocentrum crassirhizum, commonly known as the broad-rooted starling plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its root system is notably robust and extensive, which helps it thrive in nutrient-poor soils. This plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and coastal areas.
